column1: #Text=Polycrystalline samples of ScRuSi were synthesized by an arc-melting method.
#Text=The starting materials were ruthenium powder, silicon powder and scandium foil, all purer than 99.9%.
#Text=In order to avoid shattering during the melting reaction, the Sc foils were pre-melted into buttons under purified argon.
#Text=Powders of elemental Ru and Si were mixed in a molar ratio of 1:1, pelletized and then mixed with a stoichiometric amount of Sc buttons.
#Text=The mixtures were arc-melted under an argon atmosphere for at least ten times with intermediate turnovers to ensure the sample homogeneity.
#Text=The weight loss after arc-melting was always less than 1%.
#Text=Some of the samples were directly measured, while the others were wrapped with tantalum foils, sealed into evacuated quartz tubes, and annealed at 1273 K for a week.
#Text=All the samples showed metallic luster and were stable in air, whether annealed or not.
#Text=Superconductivity was observed only in the as-prepared samples, and was absent above 1.8 K in the annealed ones.
